issue.title: [C++] Add split_pattern_regex function
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12608](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12608). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Currently the split_pattern compute kernel can split strings by a given pattern, but it'd be really helpful if the specified pattern could be a regular expression

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12608?focusedCommentId=17337284) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
It would probably be a separate kernel rather than an option, but yes, that would be useful.

cc `[~maartenbreddels]`

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12608?focusedCommentId=17337317) by Maarten Breddels (maartenbreddels):*
I agree a split_pattern_regex might make sense, you might want to look at

<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8271> and possible <https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8459>

for inspiration.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12608?focusedCommentId=17349252) by David Li (lidavidm):*
